title: Real-time Monitoring of Economic Shocks using Company Websites
author: Michael König (ETH Zurich), Jakob Rauch (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam), Martin Wörter (ETH Zurich), ...
relevance_why: The paper's use of Large Language Models (LLMs) for real-time economic monitoring and the extraction of information from textual data can inform audio-visual applications, particularly in data alignment or crisis response modeling in audio generation frameworks.
background: Developing a tool that quantifies the impact of economic shocks on companies by analyzing text data from their websites to facilitate timely responses and decision-making in policy and business environments.
contribution: This paper introduces the Web-Based Affectedness Indicator (WAI) to solve the problem of timely economic monitoring, achieving accurate real-time assessments of company performance during economic shocks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional methods rely on surveys and administrative data, which are often delayed and limited in scope.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by leveraging continuous web-sourced data and LLM classification to provide real-time insights at an unprecedented scale.

key_innovation: Utilizes advanced natural language processing techniques on large datasets to dynamically assess economic impacts at the firm level, enabling faster and more accurate responses than conventional methods.
real_world_impact: The methodology offers significant potential for enhancing economic resilience and policy-making during crises, allowing stakeholders to react promptly to emerging challenges.
limitations: The effectiveness of WAI may vary in regions with less internet access or lower English proficiency due to the dataset's underlying assumptions.

new_terms.Web-Based Affectedness Indicator: **Web-Based Affectedness Indicator (WAI)** is a newly developed tool that analyzes company website data to assess the impact of external economic shocks in real time.

open_sourcing: The tool for downloading and processing website data is published open source on GitHub.
